oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Summer mortality of the Pacific cupped oyster Crassostrea gigas in the Bay of Marennes-Oleron (France). Spatial variability of environmental parameters, growth and production rates using a Geographical Information System (GIS)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Soletchnik, Patrick
Le Moine, Olivier
Razet, Daniel
Geairon, Philippe
Faury, Nicole
Goulletquer, Philippe
Robert, Stephane
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Marennes Oleron Bay
Geogaphical Information System
GIS
Production
Growth
Crassostrea gigas
Oysters
Summer mortality
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Marennes-Oleron Bay is the first rearing area in Europe for the cupped oyster, with 35 000 tons proudced on a yearly basis. This species has suffered several chronic summer mortalities for the last 10 years.
